revised_title: Dynamic Deformation of Transversely Loaded Disks Under Shock Loads
tldr: The authors study the deformation of thin metal disks under dynamic loads, specifically the response times for a copper disk. They explain the deflection under shock loading conditions by combining the action of inertia and strain waves. The research compares the deflection of a disk to that of an extensible wire under similar conditions, suggesting a simple analogy for future analysis.
